A doctor told me the knee pain was just the normal wear and tear of age and there was nothing to be done (I was in my mid-40s). I did a mindfulness exercise focusing on my feet and realised that my seemingly comfortable sneakers were pinching my pinky toes and that this was actually normal for me and had been for years. I went looking for wider shoes and found my way to barefoot shoes. With my first pair, all my foot pain went away in a couple of weeks. A few years later, I got a yet wider pair of barefoot shoes that really left my pinky toes unconstricted and also started massaging the muscle near my left pinky toe. At this point, my knee pain went away too. As Adriene says, it's all connected.
